headline: Enforcement & Removal Assistant at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) & Retired Soldier
summary:
Sergeant First Class (E-7), US Army October 1991âOctober 2011
Completed 20-year career with the U.S. Army.  Gained upper-level manager status. Over 17 years of successful management and leadership experience with a reputation for meeting the most challenging organizational goals and objectives. A pragmatic and focused individual recognized for âmaking seemingly impossible situations work.â A proven and VERIFIABLE record for:
â¢ Producing higher performance standards and enhancing productivity during a period of shrinking budgets and downsizing resources.
â¢ Automating departments. As a leader of the Northwestern Region of the Army Recruiting Command for a 10,000 personnel installation, automated major control system, increasing the effective resource utilization rate from 33% to 95% in less than 12 months. 
â¢ Controlling growth management - able to motivate and maximize productivity and employee morale without financial incentives. Took a station with the lowest performance level (out of 52 stations) and improved to #7 ranking in less than 12 months.
â¢ Developing and implementing highly successful strategic plans (short and long term). Established inventory/purchasing control systems that gained accountability for millions of dollars in equipment.

Goals: 
To utilize my extensive background in planning, directing and successful leadership by managing support staff, vendors, processes and development teams in order to surpass stakeholder expectations.  My strong interpersonal skills and communications mastery lend me to be an effective resource in working with high-level management and executives as well as external/internal clients. I would like to continue practicing my project management skills by leading teams through requirements gathering and analysis to project planning, solution deployment, and support. I thrive in dynamically changing environments requiring focused decision making and have been successful in team environments and working independently.

positions.description:
Performs critical support functions concerning personnel, correspondence, information flow, and time keeping. Responsible for providing HR guidance to personnel concerning items such as leave time, business travel, and standardized reporting procedures. Performs onboarding tasks for both military and civilian personnel. Organizes meetings and serves as the point of contact for all civilian related personnel matters. Regularly prepares reports, maintains the Commanderâs official calendar, and performs timekeeping duties in accordance with Defense Civilian Pay System policies.
â¢	Efficiently screens incoming and outgoing mail to ensure compliance with regulations.
â¢	Serve as the Microsoft SharePoint site administrator and the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) officer.
positions.title: Administrative Support Technician

positions.description:
Administered standardized aptitude and qualification exams for applicants of the various U.S. military branches at MEPS and Military Entrance Test (MET) locations. Responsible for ensuring test candidates understood the exam process while forwarding results to appropriate entities in a timely manner. Accountable for maintaining overall security of the exam materials, testing process, and assessment results.
â¢	Developed expertise in all aspects of office related software including Microsoft Office Suite, Adobe Acrobat, and SharePoint.
positions.title: Test Administrator

positions.description:
Answered requests for emergency response throughout the property while patrolling and ensuring a safe environment for employees and guests. As a report writer, performed in-depth investigations into incidents to ensure accurate narratives were compiled and submitted. Utilized standard techniques to interview witnesses, suspects, and victims to determine incident causes while maximizing guest safety and protecting the best interests of the company.
â¢	Earned recognition for exemplary service; chosen to provide specialty security services for the elite Encore Beach Club. 
â¢	Identified as one of the top 1% of security personnel at the resort.
positions.title: Security Officer

positions.description:
Accountable for interviewing, screening, and processing qualified applicants for the U.S. Army. Administer entrance exams and interpret results. Guided prospective recruits to appropriate job classifications based on testing scores and interview results. Ensured established onboarding process is executed efficiently and according to policy. Interfaced with school administrators, recruiters, and applicants to answer questions and provide career guidance.
â¢	Recognized for exceptional leadership ability.
positions.title: Guidance Counselor & Assistant Senior Guidance Counselor

positions.description:
Supervised the operations of a recruiting office serving eleven high schools and four colleges. Mentored non-commissioned subordinates while maintaining all critical personnel records and enabling professional development. In addition to the regular HR duties related to administering the day to day operations of the recruiting station, assumed the Acting Regional Manager equivalent role. Held overall responsibility for the cannot fail mission of leading, training, and overall supervision of seven station commanders and thirty-eight non-commissioned officers spread over an area of 20K-square miles.
â¢	Enhanced efficiency and effectiveness by developing an innovative metric for evaluating performance standards that was implemented throughout the country.
â¢	Implemented a ground-breaking publicity campaign, resulting in a Station Advertising and Promotions Program that exceed goals by more than 200%.
positions.title: Area Talent Acquisition Coordinator/Manager & Acting Regional Talent Acquisition Coordinator/Manager

positions.description:
Oversaw the operations of a recruiting office serving an 1800-square mile area. Supervised a team of three non-commissioned officers while ensuring lead generation, drug screening, and interviews were conducted in a timely manner and in accordance with standard Army procedure. Ensured station compliance with privacy regulations and maintained secure files for all candidates.
â¢	Displayed exceptional knowledge of automated systems to enhance the efficiency of the HR processes within the U.S. Army.
â¢	Mentored assigned staff; ensured adherence to critical deadlines and achievement of goals and objectives
positions.title: Area Talent Acquisition Coordinator/Manager

positions.description:
Exhibited expert community relations skills within a 500-square mile area including four high schools and two college campuses. Collaborated with Military Entrance Processing Command to administer standardized testing and evaluation of prospective recruits. Advised and counseled students of vocational options as determined by their test scores. Performed thorough, in-person interviews of qualified candidates. Utilized multiple techniques including cold calling and public presentations to recruit some of Americaâs best and brightest for the U.S. Army.
â¢	Recognized as one of the top performing recruiters in the northwestern United States.
â¢	Regularly exceeded annual goals and expectations.
positions.title: Area Talent Acquisition Coordinator

positions.description:
Delivered extraordinary training and mentoring to aspiring non-commissioned officers. Utilized office automated systems to accurately complete performance and academic evaluations of students enrolled in the U.S. Army Primary Leadership Development Course. Prepared lecture and course materials while assisting in all aspects of the training program.
â¢	Received Instructor of the Quarter Award in recognition of exceptional curriculum development and training delivery.
â¢	Authored article concerning inequities between combat and non-combat roles in the U.S. Army, published in Army Times Newspaper.
positions.title: Small Group Leader/Instructor

positions.description: Responsible for the training, leading, health, welfare, administrative actions and professional development of one Non-Commissioned Officer & five Soldiers; supervises the receipt, storage, distribution of ammunition & supplies; orders fire to destroy enemy equipment, positions and personnel; advises on tactical situations to shape the battlefield, requests and adjust supporting fires; supervises maintenance and is accountable for over $500,000 worth of equipment including 2 M996 TOW HMMWVâs, 1 M998 HMMWV, 2 M2 .50 Caliber Machine Guns, 2 MK19 Automatic Grenade Launchers, 2 TOW Missile Launchers with all their organic equipment, Nuclear Biological & Chemical equipment, communication & night vision equipment; ensures section is prepared for no-notice deployment by parachute assault.
positions.title: Infantryman
